result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrin L. Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant also to pay for the costs of his Dean counsel in this case.  Full reimbursement shall be made to Richland County.  This debt may be added to the Defendant's existing payment plan.  Failure to pay the Dean fees and costs in this case will result in entry of a docketed civil judgment against the Defendant, in favor of the Richland County Clerk of Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrin L. Wilson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Darrin L. Wilson
Current: 26940 Carpenter Lane, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2014)
Prior: 26940 Carpenter Lane, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States
clerk's correspondence to def re attorney fees owed
for Discharge of Attorney and Disbursement of Fees
from Atty. Johnson to the clerk - order for discharge of attorney with attached invoice; fowarded by the clerk to Judge Rosborough this date for approval

Defendant Darrin L. Wilson in court with attorney Curtis Johnson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer A Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  2 cases called together:  13CT48 and 14CF7.  DA states the parties have a resolution calling for dismissal/read-in of 13CT48 and amendment down of the charge in 14CF7 for a costs-only disposition on a charge of misdemeanor possession of cocaine.  Atty. Johnson withdraws his previously-filed motion re delay of prosecution.  Court allows the amendment of the CF to a CM charge of possession of cocaine.  Def pleads no contest to the amended charge.  Court's colloquy re plea.  DA comments on the proposed resolution.  Atty. Johnson comments on the proposed resolution.  Atty. Johnson has noted that he was court-appointed and the costs of the court appointment will be added to the def's payment plan, along with the costs associated with this case.  Court sentences def to costs only.  The CT case is ordered dismissed and read in.
Motion hearing on April 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Johnson.  13CT48 and 14CF7 called together.  Atty. J has filed motions to dismiss in 14CF7.  Judge Sharp states that he cannot preside in 14CF7 because the charges date back to 2008 when he was DA.  Since this case will need to be re-assigned, Atty. J makes a request/motion to substitute also in 13CT48.  DA notes that request is no longer timely but she has no objection because it would be more efficient to have both matters heard by the same judge and scheduled to track together.  Judge Sharp allows Atty. J's request to substitute in 13CT48.  Both cases will be assigned a new judge and scheduled by the new judge.
Status conference on March 26, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Johnson for 14CF7.  Atty. Johnson notes that he is not formally assigned to 13CT48.  Court appoints Atty. Johnson to 13CT48 as well.  Both cases called together with AIA for 14CF7 and status for 13CT48.  

In 14CF7, Atty. Johnson states that the def will waive his right to prelim time limits, preserving right to have prelim at a later date.  At this point, Atty. J requests prelim scheduling in 14CF7 and status in 13CT48.  Status conference scheduled for 03-26-2014 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 19, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
from Atty Johnson requesting reschedule of AIA 02/05/14 to 02/19/14 @ 3:30. No objection from DA.

Adjourned initial appearance on February 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting Atty Jennifer A. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Darrin L. Wilson in court without counsel. Def waives formal reading of the charge. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Court informs def of his right to counsel. Def has contacted the PD office but does not qualify. Court will appoint Atty Curtis Johnson to the case, def is to be on a payment plan for attorney fees at rate of $100/month beginning 02/15/14. AIA set for 02/05/14 @ 3.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
